intro: Sumatroscirpus minor, commonly known as the lesser sumatran sedge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swampy areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
